UX Methods

Discipline

Elements on which this page's resource focus

  • User Behavior: "Insight into how users interact with an interface, service, or product"
  • Task Completion Insight: Insight into the rate at which and ease with which users are able to complete a concrete task or set of tasks
  • User Satisfaction: "The degree to which users feel they are able to effectively and easily meet their needs with a given interface
  • Navigation Effectiveness: Insight into users' ability to easily and effectively locate content via navigation affordances

Accessing the attributes of a returned resource

  • Interaction Design
  • Heuristic Evaluation

http://purl.org/dc/elements/1.1/description Usability Evaluation focuses on how well users can learn and use a product to achieve their goals. It also refers to how satisfied users are with that process. To gather this information, practitioners use a variety of methods that gather feedback from users about an existing site or plans related to a new site.

Non-page based SPARQL query

Discipline Label Description Methods
Interaction Design Interaction design focuses on creating engaging interfaces with well thought out behaviors. First Click Testing Contextual Interviewing Card Sorting Stakeholder Interviewing Interviewing Wireframing Prototyping
Content Strategy "Content strategy focuses on the planning, creation, delivery, and governance of content." Stakeholder Interviewing Content Auditing Category Design Interviewing
Visual Design Visual design focuses on the aesthetics of a site and its related materials by strategically implementing images, colors, fonts, and other elements. A successful visual design does not take away from the content on the page or function. Instead, it enhances it by engaging users and helping to build trust and interest in the brand. Wireframing Prototyping Style Tile Creation Style Tile Creation
User Research "User research focuses on understanding user behaviors, needs, and motivations through observation techniques, task analysis, and other feedback methodologies" First Click Testing Contextual Interviewing Card Sorting Stakeholder Interviewing Interviewing Card Sorting
Information Architecture "Information architecture (IA) focuses on organizing, structuring, and labeling content in an effective and sustainable way in order to help users find information and complete tasks." Wireframing Prototyping Stakeholder Interviewing Category Design Category Design Interviewing Card Sorting Navigation Design Prototyping Navigation Design Open Card Sorting
Usability Evaluation Usability Evaluation focuses on how well users can learn and use a product to achieve their goals. It also refers to how satisfied users are with that process. To gather this information, practitioners use a variety of methods that gather feedback from users about an existing site or plans related to a new site. First Click Testing Contextual Interviewing Card Sorting First Click Testing Heuristic Evaluation First Click Testing Heuristic Evaluation Closed Card Sorting
